title: Contract Formation and Legal Enforceability
summary: Explains the basic principles of forming a valid and legally enforceable contract.
text: A contract is legally binding when both parties have the intention to create legal relations, provide valid consideration, and agree upon clear terms. Breach of contract can lead to legal remedies including damages or specific performance.

title: Understanding Intellectual Property Rights
summary: Covers the protection of creative works and inventions under IP law.
text: Intellectual property rights safeguard original works such as inventions, literary and artistic creations, symbols, and names. These rights ensure creators can benefit from their own work through patents, trademarks, or copyrights.

title: Overview of Criminal Liability and Prosecution
summary: Introduces the basic principles of criminal liability and prosecution process.
text: Criminal law governs acts considered offenses against the state or public. Prosecution typically involves proving both the physical act (actus reus) and the mental intent (mens rea).

title: Tort Law and Negligence Principles
summary: Outlines how tort law addresses harm caused by negligence or intentional acts.
text: Tort law provides remedies to individuals who have suffered harm due to another's negligent or intentional conduct. Negligence requires proof of duty, breach, causation, and damages.
